column4: Hello Guys, I'm using Ubuntu 8.10 and I have lost my sound (yet again.) I've had this issue before, but it happened so long ago I honestly can't remember where to start. I'll gladly open my terminal and absorb any help that you guys might be able to offer.
I only get a crackling sound from my speakers
go into a terminal type alsamixer
the master is turned all the way up. It shows HAD Intel as the card
is this the line I should use? sudo aptitude --purge reinstall linux-sound-base alsa-base alsa-utils linux-image-`uname -r` linux-ubuntu-modules-`uname -r` libasound2
don't bother, in alsamixer are any the outputs showing mm?
No, I don;t see anything labeled as mm
I can;t see a way to turn up the others ...PCM, IEC958
what are you usng to test sound?
Well.... that was the single MOST simplest linux fix I have ever been involved with. LOL
You can;t take my Thank You away. ;) Thanks
I wonder what makes the second meter (PCM) go to all zeros
